Reviews.Title: “Convient Place to Lay your head with lots of stairs!”
Reviews.Author: Pr0udUSAFwife
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 2 evenings. The room was nice to stay in along with comfortable bed. The tram is literally right outside so you can hear it if you are a light sleeper. They did have a fan in the room; so that helped with drawning out the noise of the tram & outside noise. This place has several stairs to go up & down to get to the rooms & bottom floor. As for me being pregnant; it was nice exercise since I was getting enough of that around town, but I didnt enjoy it so much once I was 'trying' to make it back to my room huffying & puffing! LOL Staff was great; very nice & friendly! Breakfast was typical European style breakfast; juices, breads, cereal, cakes, hard boiled eggs, lunch meats, & Ooo they even made fresh scrambled eggs for you :) Which was very yummy & nice of them :) Only thing I disliked; was having to walk up & down so many steep stairs & with luggage! And we put on the outside of our door 'do not disturb' and someone still came in our room to change the sheets & clean & vaccum... WE honestly were not to happy about that... But we DID prepare just in case it was going to happen like it did :( I would recommend this place to anyone that would like to stay a night or two. There is parking right outside the building if your able to find a spot; 36 euro for 24 hour or they offer hourly rates as well... Easy walk to the tram 1/2 lock... only 2 lines to get on to get to & from downtown back to the hotel which made it easy to remember... line 16 & 24 :) Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very odd place”
Reviews.Author: Ruby2000
Reviews.Content: This was quite an odd place to stay. We had a room in the basement. It was ok, but not great. The carpet was old and grotty but the twin beds were quite comfortable. There was no light due to not having a window. The shared bathroom was very nice. The breakfast was quite extensive. The hotel is a little walk from museum plein area. I have stayed in better hotels in Amsterdam at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, great location, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: PaulParks
Reviews.Content: I am spending a few days here in advance of a cruise. Every one of the staff have done their utmost to be helpful, as if they live to serve - a very nice welcome to the city center which begins only blocks away. On quiet street in residential neighborhood, but only a block or so from tram, restaurants, museums. Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum about a 10 minute walk NNW; old town beyond. Breakfast bar of coffee, tea, juice, fruit, cold cereal, bread, cold cuts, cheese, soft boiled eggs. Eggs scrambled or fried to order. I am staying in room #8 on the third floor. It is so quiet inside, I can't tell whether there is anyone else staying in the hotel. There is a small balcony. The room is adequate if not spacious. There is worn paint in places - especially in stairwell, but everything is otherwise in good repair and very clean. Arrived to find the room was made up with a double bed instead of a twin as wanted. They immediately moved in another single to make things right. Had problems with WiFi which they very quickly attended to.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for making our stay pleaseant!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller E
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in this hotel. Friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast, nice room, good room service, good location. I'd especially recommend this hotel to younger couples and those who want to explore the Amsterdam on it's more relaxed side.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, good transport links & plenty for breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Kate P
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Washington for 2 nights and had 2 different rooms - we booked a room with a shared bathroom but we were upgraded to an ensuite for the second night. Our first room was in the basement (down 1 flight of stairs from reception) and was meant to be a twin, but on request they had pushed the beds together to make a 'double'. The room was pretty big and had plenty of spare pillows, blankets, etc, and a couple of chairs. The only thing I would criticise is that there was no mirror! There was one in the bathroom though, and the corridor. It was lovely and warm throughout the hotel. The shared bathroom was big and clean, with a good hot shower. Shower gel/soap were provided and there was a hairdryer, although I took my own so didn't use it. Our second room was room 8, which was up 3 flights of stairs - in hindsight I'm not sure how much of an upgrade it was, and at a guess I would say someone may have requested less stairs, haha. The room was smaller, as was the bathroom but obviously the bonus was that it was ensuite. We also had a little balcony which would be lovely in summer, and a proper double bed. Plenty of choice at breakfast - warm croissants and bread rolls, cereals, yoghurt, fruit juice, eggs, toast, jam/butter/chocolate spread, ham & cheese, fruit, packaged waffles, etc. The breakfast room (which doubles up as reception during the day) is quite small so you may have to wait a little bit for other people to leave. Transport links were good, there are about 4 different tram lines near by that will take you pretty much anywhere you need to go. Although we did manage to get off a stop too early on our way there the first time and ended up about half a mile in the wrong direction - luckily the weather was nice and we didn't have many bags! There are lots of little vouchers/discount cards hanging up in the reception hallway with museum offers on and some other leaflets inside. There is also a vending machine downstairs for any late night cravings... I booked via hotels.com. Don't forget to take cash to pay, as there was a 4% charge when I used my debit card.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good service, easy to reach with tram, steep stairs, near to museums and street market, good breakfast, clean rooms and toilets

Reviews.Title: “:D”
Reviews.Author: sexylinguini
Reviews.Content: Very clean big rooms and bathrooms, couldn't expect more. Really lovely staff. I thought the breakfast would be pointless but I was wrong... Great selection! The stairs is really steep but that's one reason that made me pick this hotel. The location is perfect for the museums, which I have very little interest in. I didn't realise the walk to the centre was so awkward and long (can be done in 30mins but realistically 45-60mins after you stop here and there...) Also if your hungry or thirsty late at night, don't expect to find anywhere quick and cheap near the hotel. Overall really enjoyed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again, such a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: flowerbones
Reviews.Content: Hotel Washington is on a lovely residential street which is quiet and pretty. I would say it is in the De Pijp area, very close to vondelpark, the rijksmuseum and concert hall. At first you might feel a bit out of the way but you will soon realise you are not too far from the centre and are in a good area in terms of restaurants and cafes. The outside of the hotel is very nice. There are 4 flights of stairs and we stayed on the top floor - the stairs are steep and curl round at the top so if you struggle with stairs either hope to stay on the first or second floor (there is no elevator). The interior is authentic and has a homely feel to it. It's warm too - we went in December and hoped it wouldn't be cold and the shower would have hot water. We weren't disappointed. The shower was always hot and rooms were warm. Our room was a standard double with a shared bathroom. The bedroom was clean, bright and a decent size and we had a sink in our room and a tv hich had BBC1 and BBC2, CNN and the disney channel in English. The shared bathroom consisted of two separate rooms - a toilet in one, and a shower next to it. Both were clean and smelt fresh. The toilet was small but I suppose there's not much need for it to be any bigger. The shower was similarly small but I wouldn't say it was cramped - there was enough space to shower comfortably and dry off afterwards. Breakfast was very good, I was impressed. It is served between 8am and 10am in the dining area on the ground floor. The hotel smells like fried eggs and coffee in the mornings which I thought was lovely. The breakfast consisted of the following: a selection of cheese and ham, croissants, pre-packaged waffles, crackers, a selection of breads, mini baguettes, toast, jams, chocolate spread, butter, cornflakes, granola cereal, sugar puffs cereal, fruit yoghurt, milk, cream, fruit salad, pears, apples, bananas, orange and apple juice, fresh ground coffee and hot water and a good selection of tea bags. I am a vegan and was concerned breakfast would be poor for me but I bought some separate soya milk to put on cereal and had plenty of jam on toast and fruit. When we arrived were greeted by a pleasant lady. She gave us information about the hotel and gave us a map. The staff are all very pleasant and English speaking - I'm sure I heard them speaking in Spanish and other languages too. To summarise - good location, nice hotel, nice staff, great breakfast. I would stay here again or recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in a nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: DigbyDagmar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at this small hotel near the museum district. We reserved the 2 person "superior room". The hotel is a bit off the beaten path (tucked behind the main museums and concert hall on a small street that is on the way to nowhere). If you are in Amsterdam to see the Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh Museum, the Stedelijk Museum, or going to a concert at the Concertgebouw, there may not be a more reasonable place to stay. If you are a young person and interested in the night life of Amsterdam, there may be more convenient locations other than this hotel although the tram is very convenient and does go directly to the central district. The room was tidy and comfortable with a nice balcony. Breakfast was traditional Dutch hard rolls, meat, cheese, hard boiled eggs, tea and coffee and they offered to cook eggs to order. Hours for the breakfast were from 8:00-10:00. The stairs are very steep (traditional Amsterdam fashion) and there is no lift. People with limited walking capabilities should not choose this hotel. For most people, the stairs are just part of the Amsterdam experience. We loved our experience at this hotel and will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: elodie975
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Friday evening around 9pm and the guy was so nice, he can advise you about the site to visit and the place or things to do. My room was a single with own bathroom, small but really cosy. the only thing was, that the room was on the 3rd floor and the stairs were difficult to high. The breakfast is a buffet with toast, croissant, local food, ham, cheese, tea coffee and orange juice. The location was great and 5 minutes walk, a bus to go to the airport. Located near Van gogh ;useum, it's only 10mins walk to leideseplein place and the center.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Effort needed”
Reviews.Author: Bob A
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room on the second floor at this hotel. In agreement with other review in should really be called a B&B Good Location steep stairs and small rooms but hey thats amsterdam for you failings no cups, tea coffee etc in the rooms but a kettle ? dated rooms in need of a coat of paint towels not changed during my stay breakfast doesnt start until 8 that is a little late for some

Reviews.Title: “Great View, value, and a B&B feel!”
Reviews.Author: Buffaloeric
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Washington is located on a quiet residential street extremely close to the heart of Amsterdam. Just a short walk to Leidensplein and an easy tram ride to Dam Square. Location is a definite strength. I hotel is a 4 story building with a B&B feel. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, and were available at all hours. I had a single room with a private shower, everything I could have wanted, a tv, desk, comfy bed, closet, hangers, safe, shower, towels.... everything a tourist needed. Being employed in the hospitality industry I cherish the small B&B's that give you the personal feel and quiet rooms. I understand the draw of a larger hotel but you can't beat their prices of around 100 euro per night with a cool hotel and an awesome location. I definitely recommend this hotel, as well as return their again when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but old room”
Reviews.Author: Luca_Luo
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 people room and had an apartment with living room, kitchen and a small garden. The room is rather spacious compared to other hotel rooms in Amsterdam. But the furniture in the room and the quilt & pillow on the bed looks a little bit old. Although we had a kitchen, I guess nobody will use it since the appliance is not looks that clean and if you want to use them, you'll definitely wash it all over again. We're lucky to have a room on the ground floor so that we do not need to step on the dangerous stairs. The location of the hotel is rather nice. We park our car in the P+R of Olympic Stadium and take Tram 16 or 24 to the Museumsplein, it's only 5 minutes walk to the hotel. Tram 16 or 24 also can take you to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but room overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: shazza19601966
Reviews.Content: staff very helpful, great location, we had a room with balcony at the front. we paid 120.00 per nite 4 the superior room, which had 2 chairs,table,t.v,shower and a KETTLE. no cups,milk,tea,sugar!! u have 2 pay seperately??? we bought our own!! walls thin u cld hear people using the toilet! otherwise ok but overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “The Washington: Good Value for money in Amsterdam â€“ just beware the steep stairs and small bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: VLBJhb
Reviews.Content: Some Commendations: -The hotel is located in the museum quarter which was a perfect location â€“ close to transport and the major museums (and beautiful museumplein) but still quiet at night. -The hotel is also located in a typical Amsterdam house which was very pretty. -The room, although very small and inclined (as it was in the hotel eaves), was clean, well appointed and charming with a lovely little view down the street. -The bedding was clean and new which I greatly appreciated. -The breakfast was good and it made a very good start to my day. I would simply caution that there is no bacon or sausages available. However, you can get eggs to order, a good selection of cold meats and fresh fruit. I would definitely recommend it. -There is a lovely, vibrant restaurant the manager recommends around the corner from the hotel which serves Dutch food and was good value for money. -The management was very helpful and arranged to have our baggage brought to our room which, when facing four flights of incredibly steep steps (as one does in Amsterdam) was much appreciated. -In addition I was ill when we arrived and management immediately offered to change our room to one on a lower floor in case I was not in a condition to climb the steps. -Management is very good with tips on what to see in Amsterdam and when as well as what is value for money. -The tv was a good size and functioning. -The hairdryer in the bathroom was effective. Some issues: -The stairs are steep which is a fact of life in Amsterdam and cannot be helped. Heed the hotel warning that if you are disabled, elderly or generally unable to climb such stairs, rather book a room on the first floor. -The bathroom was very small with only a shower but nicely appointed and clean. I would not recommend it for a larger person though. The only problem was that the shower curtain was ineffective and, if you were not terribly careful, the whole bathroom flooded when you showered leaving you standing in a puddle when you went to the toilet or brushed your teeth. Had it been winter I would have been very upset. The problem is easily remedied by creating a larger â€˜stepâ€™ between the shower and bathroom to hold back the water which I would recommend to the manager. -Another issue was that there was no towel rail and/or towel hooks which meant you had to hang your wet towels over the back of a chair or on a door handle. Again, easily remedied. -The bed was too soft and I kept rolling into the middle which did not always make for good rest - there was no base cover on the bed and the mattress base was visible.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rtay22
Reviews.Content: When we eventually found the place - because we got super lost, and it being tucked away on a side street, locals don't know of the place, and it was difficult to find. We were greeted by the lovely hotel owner - his name I didn't catch but I think it is a family run business and there was always someone at reception. The only down side was the massively steep stairs and for us to be told we were on the 4th floor and with no lifts had to lug our stuff all the way up, having said that the owner helped us up and I am more than grateful for that! We had a twin room with a balcony - it was lovely, it was very big and the beds were so comfortable, and the sink in the room was super convenient! The shared facilities was something I was concerned about but they were always free and clean and right next to us. Breakfast was included and was standard, the staff were very nice and offered help when we needed to find any places in dam. They even told us what the weather was going to be like! Coming back to the hotel after a long day, was a pleasure and in fact we walked to all locations - central dam and museums. House keeping was good and all in all for the price, comfort and experience I would stay there again! Thank you Hotel Washington!!

Reviews.Title: “We would happily return any time we might be back in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: TheOldiesBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days, in a comfortable, well-illuminated, clean, spacious and pleasant room on the third storey of the Hotel Washington. The staircase, steep and narrow, reminded us that we were living in Amsterdam. The room came with a balcony, and a safe, and from the hotelier the promise of any advice or assistance should we need it. For a charge we might have the washing done, or a cup of coffee. And a notice- board warned that, had we been too noisy, the consequences would be fairly draconian: this was not such a bad thing for us. The hotel is near the tram route: Amsterdamâ€™s tram service being so efficient, we could commute easily and quickly to the city centre. And the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum are an easy walk away. Breakfasts were generous and varied, â€¦ and there was additionally the offer of fried/scrambled eggs. We enjoyed staying at the Hotel Washington, and would happily return any time we might be back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, good location!”
Reviews.Author: Meta888
Reviews.Content: Nice stay! Old hotel but clean. Very steep stairs. Comfortable beds, new bathroom. Clean towels and cleaning every day! Very friendly staff, they helped us print out boardingcards for our flight and made breakfast packages when we had to leave early. Good breakfast in quite a small breakfast room, we ate early so we had no problems getting a table. Good location, very close to the museums and close to the tramstop as well.

Reviews.Title: “Service was outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: sarajmail
Reviews.Content: Everyone has mentioned the stairs; but seriously folks these are some stairs! I had reserved the basic room with shared facilities; and it's on the 4th floor!! It wasn't the shared facilites that had me wanting to move, it was the fact that the basic room is a closet..it's really small, and the window does not open. I was lucky enough that they had another room, so I got to switch for a little more money...I was happy to do so! The locaiton is great for the tram stop to get you to the central station or Dam Square, and they are just a few blocks from The Pijp where there are great restaurants. The suggestions they gave for dining were very good; and the staff was very helpful with directions, etc. The breakfast was ok, I think they could step it up a little with finer selections of meats and cheeses, as well as a higher quality of bread selections. The room was comfortable, but it needs an upgrade to some furnishings, and someone mentioned they need new towels, I'd agree. Also very loud because of people having to drag their luggage up the steps. Service made it a great stay, but conditions would have me choosing another location on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and sunny bright room”
Reviews.Author: TheShoppelifter
Reviews.Content: Booked a single room via booking.com (my nightsaver) costs EUR55 with breakfast. The location of hotel is not actually right in the central part. About 7 tram stop from the Amsterdam central train station via tram no. 16 or 24, tram station called Ruysdaelstraat. Although it is walking distance (approx. 10 min.) to museumplein for the Van Gogh museum and other museum in the area as well as the huge Vondelpark. Situated in a quiet neighborhood, the hotel itself looks like an apartment, you have to press the buzzer to be let in. Electronic keycard lets you in the main door and your room. Peach or pink coloured room, enough space to move around, double-bed, tv on study table, electric fan, safety deposit box ( wonder if it work), coffee making facility - minus the coffee or tea though, clean toilet, curtain separated shower stand. The large windows opens up to a huge tree and the pleasant street below and a crawling plant, making the room airy and sunlit. Just as most Amsterdam hotel, the stairs are steep so hold on to the railings, and my room is on the 3rd floor so a bit of struggle. The breakfast room is the reception area too and breakfast is quite ok with variety. Staff are good too, asian-looking fellows. Price/value ratio...I would recommended this hotel, plus I got my coat back when I forgot it inside the cabinet and went back for it when I was already at the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: eve_slab
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is situated near Rijksmuseum and Vondelpark - very nice and quiet location. It's walking distance to the city centre and near the tram stop. The room itself was small but comfortable, we shared bathroom with other rooms on the floor and it was OK (no queue in the morning :) ) We also had the breakfast included and it was a good start for the day and you can eat whatever you want. The only negative I see that while check out you have to pay in cash, you can pay by card but the hotel charge you 4% :(

Reviews.Title: “The service made the difference”
Reviews.Author: Montypas
Reviews.Content: The Washington hotel needs new towels,the towels are very old. The rooms carpets are old also. They do not provide face tissues. The breakfast is very good. No elevator,the stairs are very steep;so if you are advance in age this hotel is not for you. But all this negatives are cancel by the outstanding service that is provided by the two young man working there. I would rate the service a 5 star hotel service. Because of them,and as long as they are there;I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stairs so many stairs”
Reviews.Author: wicorthered
Reviews.Content: As others have stated the stairs are a bit crazy. Very steep, I'd imagine many a late night party goer has come a cropper on them. The guys that run the place were nice enough, although they did seem to have an awful lot of rules, that they pasted everywhere, the rules made me feel like I was in a hostel. The location isn't bad, the museums are near and the tram is handy. The room was OK it had a shared bathroom, a fact I wasn't aware of until I arrived. The towels I was provided with were tiny and raggedy. The bed was uncomfortable. The price was very good though.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: travellingcnuck
Reviews.Content: Located 1 bus or 1 tram away from the airport or Central Station, the hotel is located walking distance from most of Amsterdam. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly, and the included breakfast was great. The room was clean and the bed was fairly comfortable. It was small, but a typical size of European hotels. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a good price in a quiet part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Honest family hotel”
Reviews.Author: monxton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location, three minutes from the tram stop and in a quiet street. It is run by a nice family, who keep it very clean. The extra charge for credit cards was carefully explained at check-in, so you have every chance to get cash and avoid the charge. Others have commented on the steep stairs, which are normal in this part of Amsterdam. The breakfast was varied and plentiful. Our room was warm, and a fair size with a big window, everything worked.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay with good value”
Reviews.Author: ankerstjerne
Reviews.Content: Stayes at this hotel for 3 nights after reading the good reviews and we were not disapointed. We had reservated a room for 4 persons and got 2 double rooms in the basement. Very spacious and spotles clean. We also got the roon 2 hours prior to check in time!!. The breakfast was very good vith a selection of breads, eggs, cereal and yoghurts. The neighbourhood har alao of nice restaurants. We tried and indian, an italian, and chinese. All very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel... perfect for a short trip!”
Reviews.Author: ennui80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam for 2 nights on a girlfriends' trip through Europe. We flew in from London and took a train to Centraal Station. We weren't really sure how to use the tram so we got a cab driver to take us to the hotel.. which was 15 euros so it was a bit pricey, but it seemed like everyone spoke Dutch so it saved us a headache of trying to figure out where we were. Upon check in, we were given a room on the 3rd floor which we expected to be tiny (especially for three girls), but the triple room is actually quite spacious and the beds were comfy! The receptionist offered to take our suitcases up but since he was busy checking in others, we just dragged them up the steps ourselves... (remember to pack light if you're coming here because those steps are deadly!). We got there in time for dinner and they suggested an Argentinian steakhouse a couple blocks away... oh my god... that was the most delicious steak I have ever eaten! I can't remember the name of it but I'm sure they'll tell you. We had breakfast in the breakfast room/lobby in the morning and while it wasn't fancy or anything, the service was nice and it got us going for the day. Maps of Amsterdam make it look so much larger than it actually is. We were able to walk into town and we were very close to Leidsplein and the museum district. I would recommend doing Mike's Bike Tours... great way to see Amsterdam and super fun! When we left, the receptionist brought our bags down for us and directed us on where to get the tram to the train station. Overall, I enjoyed our stay here. Hotel was quaint, and comfy and very affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean, friendly staff, dangerous stairs!”
Reviews.Author: montinaviganti
Reviews.Content: Good service and friendly staff, low prices (compared to the average Amsterdam rates), room quite big and clean (again compared to the Amsterdam standards). The hotel is rather old, located in a typical Dutch house, with original stairs, which are really steep, so I would not recommend the hotel for people with problems of disability. But after all it is nice to spend a night in a historical building. Location is also great, close to tram 5-16-24 and walking distance from museum district and city centre. Good breakfast but the breakfast room was not very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of heaven, four flights up.”
Reviews.Author: wildbirdseed
Reviews.Content: Cozy family owned hotel in converted Amsterdam style home. Rooms or apartments with private baths on each floor. Size varies. We stayed in a double bedroom with a semi-private rooftop patio. It was connected to our neighbors window but they were friends traveling with us. Quiet residential neighborhood. Near Museumplein and tram stops. Breakfast room on main floor provided ample selection. Dutch style breakfast of breads, fruits, yogurts, plus eggs made to order.

Reviews.Title: “A Family Experience”
Reviews.Author: Fay123
Reviews.Content: Rooms are basic, all single beds, warm and extremely clean. We had two rooms (one for three adult kids and one for parents). Surprisingly quiet in the hotel, other than some street noise. Was surprised to see how many other's were actually staying at the hotel when we arrived at breakfast. The breakfast was great. pretty much everything you could want and the coffee was excellent. Owners are a family that really care that you are happy. Ask them for whatever you need and they will help ... be it directions, eggs your style for breakfast, airport pickup ... what ever. They will go the extra mile. Location is great for museums. Located on very quiet street only a block from the Tram that will take you to the city center. We were there in middle of a snow storm and it was just fine. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance (1-2 blocks) from hotel. Buy 24 hour tram tickets on the Tram or at the Central Station, 7 Euros ea. As everyone says, steps to get to rooms are steep, like climbing a ladder. But the owners will help you get up and down with your luggage if needed. Don't let that deter you from going here. Wireless internet was 5 Euros for the stay per room. For location, accomodations and price you can't do better.

Reviews.Title: “better than described”
Reviews.Author: funfamilychess
Reviews.Content: Exceptional hotel, spotlessly clean, rooms large and comfortable, cost 30euro pnpp which is much less than others we were looking at, easy transport using the tram system, breakfast included everything - rolls, eggs (however you want them), jam, cheese, sliced meat, cereal, toast, coffee and tea, juices of all kinds, waffles, cake.... The owners go the extra mile - let me know when friend arrived, minded our bags before and after checkin/out, great wifi, advised re best time to go to Anne Frank's house to avoid queues and what to do when tram tickets expired 1 hour too early, supplied an international plug which was great for computer and iphone/pods, managed to work around my pin number not working so I could use my Australian credit card and offered to carry our luggage downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: oovaha
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a quiet, clean place to stay. It provides the basics: bed, bath and breakfast. The beds had soft cotton sheets (no manky polyester blends!), private bathrooms (lots of hot water, absorbent cotton towels), and a very generous breakfast. The rooms are simple and small--who goes to Amsterdam to sit around in a hotel room?!--but for the addicted, each room does have a TV. The place is near the Rijksmuseum, so hotel guests can avoid the noise of the area close to the train station. I really want to return to The Netherlands, and when I do, I will stay at Hotel Washington.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, elegant, quaint and charming!”
Reviews.Author: KSlice562
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this hotel! I've been home for two months now and I still think about the wonderful breakfast from this hotel. A very nice family runs this hotel and they personally serve you at breakfast. I stairs are steep but charming also. The warm colors on the bottom floors add historical significance. The colors on the top floor are not as appealing but still historically accurate. The rooms are quiet and clean and I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: George_Cantstanza
Reviews.Content: For the price, you won't get much better in Amsterdam - room & bathroom spotless, good service, decent breakfast, wifi for a reasonable extra charge..... and best of all, this hotel is in a very quiet location just off museumplein. There are several tram lines situated within a couple minutes walk of the hotel, as well as a direct bus service to/from the airport which is much quicker and more convenient than getting a tram to central station followed by a train to Schiphol. The only caveat (which has been mentioned by other reviewers) are the very steep stairs - if you have a lot of luggage or are a little unsteady on your feet, you're better off staying elsewhere unless you can arrange for a ground floor room at the time of booking. Otherwise, Hotel Washington is a splendid little hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, safe hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrincessNthePea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the museum district, down a quiet street. Room was comfortable in terms of size and amenities. An in room safe was available. The hotel itself was also secure. Nice breakfast was included in the mornings, and they would even scramble up some eggs for you upon request. One caveat: this hotel has some significant stairs, so if you need a ground floor room, make sure you request that at the time of your reservation. We travel light, so climbing up to the 3rd floor was not a problem for us, but it might be for some folks (and there is no elevator). Staff was very helpful and pleasant. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Washington is a quaint hotel in the Museumplein area - very quiet, but still convenient to all tourist areas.”
Reviews.Author: citygirl00110024
Reviews.Content: Fantastic small quaint hotel very near to public transportation and the MuseumPlein. It was an 8 minute very easy walk from the bus stop (that I took from the airport) to the Hotel Washington. The location is very calm and quiet, but has easy access to all of the "touristy" areas. The hotel has bikes to rent on premises. I rented for 2 days for 20 euro. It elimintate the stress of renting near central station and getting it returned on time. The two guys that ran the hotel were very accomidating - looking up things on the internet for me, helping to carry my bag up the very steep stairs. Breakfast was included and had a great assortment. The only negative thing would be the very steep stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel, very helpful staff, good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: chillipepper21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet residential area so no late night noise. It's about 10 minutes walk away from the museum area and very close to an outdoor market. The tram to the city centre stops at the top of the street so convenient for everything. Inside the hotel is small and quaint but spotlessly clean. The breakfast wasn't anything special but more than adequate....you could help yourself to as much as you wanted with unlimited tea/coffee/juice available. We had the basement which was huge...two seperate rooms which were again spotless. Only downside to this was to get down to the room you had to use a very steep staircase (more like a ladder). There was a definite knack to getting up and down the staircase! The bathroom was luxurious, the bath was so deep and lots of hot water, plenty of towels too. The staff were lovely especially the guy in the mornings. We arrived off the ferry very early and they were happy to look after our luggage even though we couldn't check in til early afternoon. They also looked after it on our final day which saved us a lot of messing around. The morning guy gave us very good advice about parking which saved us a lot of money. He also gave us ideas for restaurants in the area. He couldn't have been nicer. All in all a great place to stay that doesn't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you search for "average" solution”
Reviews.Author: oneTraveller2010
Reviews.Content: Very good location: tram stops are near and almost everything is reachable by foot Relative small rooms, but enough also if you have to work some hours in the room (as in my case). Nice service on the reception: I asked many informations (even late in the night) and they always helped me. Very good Internet connection. In my case they offered me connection for 3 days paying only 2.

Reviews.Title: “Better than photos - nice, accessible place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: cathybuster
Reviews.Content: Very near the tram stop and the museum center and Albert Cup market. (Taking a bus to and fro airport is another optioin - the stop will be in the museum center). Very hearty breakfast (really Dutch!) and the dining room is just so nice/lovely :) Nice, comfortable, and clean room (and bathroom). I got single with shared bathroom. Nice, friendly, English-speaking staff...I enjoyed talking with them... Watch out is the very steep stairs which will not be good for elderly people or for those with HUGE luggage. I think the photos here downplayed the nice place. It was better than what I saw in pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Zuhre
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the deluxe suit. It was quite big and comfortable, especially compared to what we have paid. We could walk everywhere. The tram stop was very close. People working at the hotel were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mashasmith123
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in quite district. It's close to tram station, Heineken expereince and it takes 15 minutes to ge to Centraal station. Single room is quite small but it's clean with LCD TV and comfortable bed. Hotel staff is friendly and always glad to help you. I recommend this hotel for people who want to spend their holidays in warm and queit atmosphere. Hugs from Russia!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: gerdkahn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value. Excellent breakfast in the morning. Good location close to the tram stop (200m) for trams directly to city centre. V close also to the museums. The rooms are fine and well kept. Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic room for the price, and too far from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: AnnaNottingham
Reviews.Content: This hotel was too far (1 hour walk from Central Station, approx 30 minutes by tram, number24 from Central Station), the room was upstairs , very basic and too expensive for the type of room we got. The room was with share facilities. The bed was clean and there is a TV in the room. We had to pay on our first day as soon as we arrived, which I thought it was not right, people usually pay after they are about to leave the hotel. Never happened to me or my partner, and I visited many countries where you have to pay when you leave the room. If you have mobility problems then this hotel is not for you (too many stairs and you can easily fall down). Breakfast was good, plenty of choices (bread, ham, cheese, cakes, yogurt, coffee , tea). There is wifi connection and cost Â£5. In terms of travelling to the hotel- prepare to pay approx Â£ 5.60 x 2 people to take the tram each time you go to the hotel (return) , which we thought it was too expensive (in general Amsterdam is a very expensive city). We walked to find the hotel and it took about an hour from Central Station. We didnt think it was going to be that far. There are museums near the Hotel (Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum, Stedelijk Museum). Overall, I recommend this hotel for the young traveller. The hotel was in a quiet place, so that was a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, friendly & helpful proprietors”
Reviews.Author: just_around_the_bend
Reviews.Content: I hope I get to return to Hotel Washington. While it is a bit worn, it was very clean and a great value. Ideal, quiet location with easy walk to the Museum plein or to the tram for the frequent rides to the busy downtown. The friendly, helpful owners and nice breakfast made this such a nice place to start and end each day. It only added to the fun experience to stay in a traditional Dutch house with the steep, winding staircase. Especially since the owners helped with luggage each way.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet neighnourhood, friendly owners!”
Reviews.Author: idleworm
Reviews.Content: Located in a good location and a quiet neighborhood. 5min walk to the famous Albert Cuyp market and also the Van Gogh musem and Concert-gebouw. The owners were very helpful, warm and friendly. The tram no 16 & 24 is very convenient and would bring you to about all the major sights in Amsterdam. The breakfast was excellent too. If you're booking the basic rooms (with shared facilities), it is located at the top floor (3rd floor) of the hotel. So, if you're carrying very heavy luggage like I did, it's a long long climb up. But that will always be the case for rooms with shared facilities in Europe city hotels as most of them are located on the top floors. All in all, a wonderful experience and a place I would definitely come back if I'm at Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Book here - its great”
Reviews.Author: balfronboy
Reviews.Content: Just back from a geat weekend with my sisters and mother in Amsterdam. The Hotel Washington provided a perfect base for our stay - we were allocated one of the ground floor apartments, and it easily accomodated the five of us, complete with kitchen, garden to eat in etc etc. Mr Wo is a star! He was helpful, postive and entirely customer centred. THe hotel is not in the centre of Amsterdam, but this means its quiet and cheaper than the central ones. Book it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly owners”
Reviews.Author: FBV
Reviews.Content: As stated by former reviewers, the Ho family are the soul of this hotel. At all times, they went out this way to make our stay enjoyable: first day, our plane was delayed and we arrived at midnight at the hotel, so they stayed awakened until we checked-in. Breakfast closes at 10 am, but we were allowed to have it at 10:30 or later. They gave us all the time good indications and advice. And, finally, last night, they gave us an additional room FOR FREE, just to ensure that both of us could sleep well alone (as I was travelling with my mother and we have different schedules and uses). The room we were given (room nr. 8) was on the third floor. It was ample, with a double bed, ensuite facilities and a lovely big balcony facing an interior patio, quiet and very beautiful. The other room (room nr. 3) was on the first floor, even bigger, with twin beds, ensuite facilities and two balconies facing the main street -a quite calm street, residential and tree lined. Bathrooms were quite big and clean, with toilet, sink and shower. The hotel is a typical Amsterdam house and, if you are young or don't have mobility problems, you will enjoy the very steep stairs! The worst part of the hotel were the (very) dirty carpets, that were full of stains, both in common areas and rooms. A real shame, as it is not a dirty hotel appart from that (I'm quite exigent with cleanliness), and not only towels but also sheets were changed daily. Location is very good, right in the museums district, next door to the Van Gogh and Rijksmueum (National Museum) and close to the Vondelpark (Amsterdam main park). It is a little bit far from the Red District and Central Station, but this is easily resolved by trams 16 and 24, which are very frequent and convenient. The hotel has no parking, but they advice you to park the car in a P+R located at the Olimpic Stadium and easily accesible by trams 16 and 24, in the opposite way of Central Station. The cost (â‚¬6 per 24 hours, including two tickets for public transportation) is very convenient, especially considering the extremely expensive parking fees in Amsterdam (â‚¬4 per hour, or more). On Sundays, street parking is free and it is easy to park in the hotel surrondings. All in all, a good experience in a conveniently located and very well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: girl12
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night stay at the Washington, and I couldn't receommend it highly enough. The staff were pleasant and friendly from the very start, the rooms were spacious and clean, ours had lovely balcony and a huge bathroom. Towels and bedding were changed daily, and they even supplied toiletries. The breakfast was lovely, no restrictions on how much we could eat, and when we slept in on the second day they were happy to let us come down late and told us to take our time with breakfast. They recommended and booked a taxi to take us back to the airport, and even though we were leaving before breakfast they gave us coffee and bread before we left. Only downside if there was one was that its not completely central to the city so you have to take a tram to get to it, but the 16 and 24 trams run right by the hotel and are very regular. For the money this was a top notch hotel and I would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “On a Summer Weekend this place rocked!”
Reviews.Author: RockyMtnLvr
Reviews.Content: Hotel Washington was a great spot for a nice 3 day excursion to Amsterdam.....friendly service with great command of the English language. Our room had an amazing view of the small Amsterdam skyline and sunset on a veranda. For this pricepoint and backpacking it was amenities we thought we would never have. The breakfast was great too. I wish I could go back every weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: mr_peterman
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the Hotel Washington. The room, although small, was comfortable and very clean. The staff there are pleasent and helpful also. The location is excellent, only a few minutes walk from some of the main attractions, and also, about 7 tram stops away from Dam square. Breakfast was OK, nothing special, but good enough. For the price, location and staff, I would definitely return when I go back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Absouletly Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: mitch7Ni
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay , Ho and Partner ( Cousins in Managment) have just taken this Hotel over in the last 5 months, I wish them all the success and hope this really works out for them, We were greeted with a smile, treated the best, nothing was to much trouble, the staff went out of their way to help you in any aspect you required.Day or night they were always on hand. We stayed in the Ground floor Apt in the Hotel , which I can only say made our stay in amsterdam much more memorable, The apt consists of a lounge with really comfy seating, Television with English Stations, Fireplace with imatation log fire,,electric organ for the musically minded, cd player, double doors thru to 2 single beds, dining area, desk, double wardrobes,, bookcase divides to the next set of 2 double beds and another fire, all was tastefully decorated, the heat was marvelleous, bathroom, shower, wash basin and toilet , snow white towels, excellent shower which also had a bath stool for disabled or infirm. Working kitchen was well equipped with pots, pans, full cooker, fridge freezer, toaster,coffee maker, microwave, iron, ironing board, all delph and cutlery, Back door led out to garden area, with patio table and chairs. The bed linen was spotless, the beds comfy, one would be hard pushed to find same any where else, I know we were impressed and would use the Hotel again no problem, Tram 150 metres from Door, Supermarket similiar distance, .So for anyone wishing a nice quiet relaxing hotel i would recommend The Washington, now bear in mind you are not in Dam Square, 10 mins on tram and buttons of fare gets you there. Peace and quiet after a days sightseeing and a relaxing place to come back to was well worth it. Now if you book the Apt, you have to clean the working kitchen and whatever you use, the maid does not clean up after you, not that I expected it. Maid does the rest. Albeit I made our own beds as It kept the room nice and tidy. Yes we really enjoyed our stay and would definately use this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BoboSouthEast
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have just arrived back after spending 2 nights at Hotel Washington and did not find any fault with it. The location was great. Tram 16 from central station takes about 12-15 minutes. The street was quiet. We booked a twin room with shared bathroom facilities but paid an extra â‚¬10 for ensuite and were delighted with what we got (we even had a balcony). It is within walking distance from the Van Gogh Musuem and many parks. The guys who own/run the place were very nice and the breakfast was filling. Would defintely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful experience here”
Reviews.Author: throckmo
Reviews.Content: (Note: We booked through some travelocity-type site, not sure which one). We just completed a two-week stay at the HW. Great location: Just close enough (10-minute walk) to the Centrum, canals, etc., but not in the middle of all that craziness. Von Baarlestraat just down the street had more restaurant choices, at all levels, than we could sample. Our experience at the hotel was completely 100% positive: The staff could not have been more warm, friendly, accommodating, or helpful with our many requests for assistance of all kinds. Breakfasts were delicious and plentiful, and the rooms were spacious, comfortable and well serviced during our stay. Very reasonably priced. We would definitely stay there again and look forward to doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel I'll never forget”
Reviews.Author: A-damlover
Reviews.Content: Can't understand why there are so negative comments on this hotel. My memories about it are almost 100% positive. I and my boyfriend were visiting Amsterdam in March. Hotel Washington was our second choise after Downtown Guesthouse. We had booked GH first but after I found HW on booking com we decided that this hotel will be better. And we didn't regret a lil' bit. Hotel owner and staff were very friendly, understanding and helpful. we booked rooms via website but I also called the hotel to get more info on some particular things we wished to be arranged and got all answers I needed. Communication via e-mails also was fast and polite. We also were satisfied with rooms we've got. Especially with my double room. My friend arrived to Amsterdam a few days earlier and booked a single room (very small one, even smaller than the one shown in the photo on this site). It had absolutely no extra space but a narrow walk next to bed and closet. Bathroom was also very small. But that wasn't a problem. All he needed was the place to sleep a couple nights till I arrived and we moved to the double room. Hotel has only 2 double rooms, both on 3rd floor. Most people find it the major flaw that there is no elevator and steps are so steep. Sure it's not the most convenient thing with suitcases but that's what old Amsterdam architecture is. So we expected to find this and were pretty ok with that. We got the blue double room (another, according to photos on hotel page, is pink) and I was really happy about that. The room was quite spacious with quine size bed in the middle. The bed was OK (not too hard or too soft) and we even found 2 extra pillows in the wall closet. 2 soft chairs, magazine table and desk with TV. Can't say if it worked well though since we had no time for TV :-) But we gladly used the vase we found there (for my roses). The large room window faced the inner yard and had the door to the balcony. Bathroom was a bit larger than the one in the single room but looked similar: toilet, sink with large mirror, shower. it had air conditioning/fan, hairdryer, toiletries for 2. I was missing the only 2 things- curtain for shower and where to hang towels. As far as cleanliness goes, we had no problems with room service. Everything was cleaned nicely each day (some time after breakfast while we were out in the city). Bedsheets and towels were clean and changed daily. Linen wasn't brand new but cleanliness is what matters most. I just wished material wasn't so rough (not good for sensitive skin)... One of main feature we had chosen this hotel were reviews mentioning it's clean. the second one was safety. And we truly experienced that on us. As I said, my friend arrived earlier, so he had time to get aquainted with a friendly owner of the hotel as well as with lobby guys. When I arrived it was too early to check in so guys let me put my luggage at my friend's and take it later when my room available. The owner wasn't there at that time and we met him only when we were leaving my friend's room after I checked in and took my suitcases from friend's room. Since the owner didn't see me checking in he didn't know who I am, so he told us they didn't allow guests' visits. Sure it was about guests from outside the hotel. He was ok about my it after we explained him I'm their own guest. Second safety related thing was a personal safe in each room. I should admit helpfulness of staff here. It was enough just mention that safe doesn't lock (someone forgot to reset the code after using it) and guys came, opened it with a key and taught me how to use it to avoid problems in the future. We were served with same kindness at breakfast too. They served boiled eggs as part of breakfast. We were asked if we want them boiled soft or hard, or medium. When medium was too soft for me the first morning I asked to boil it more next time and got it boiled the right way. So, I can say they really care for guest's needs in each smallest request. The breakfast itself wasn't something extraordinary but it gave a choice of cereals, yogurt, several kinds of meat, cheese, bread, jams and honey, tea, coffee. I wouldn't ask for anything more.. well, maybe for fresh fruit to go with cereals and yogurt :-). We brought our own fruit the other day. Well, what else? Location. We found it GREAT. Close to main museums and tram stops. Just a couple streets to one or other side from hotel. Noise? The hotel was full of guests but there was no noise out there. The only "noise" was a pleasant one- singing of birds heard from inner yard early in the morning. Sometimes we heard our neighbors laughing or talking while passing our door but nothing through the walls or from the street. Oh, and sure I need to mention the CAT. It wasn't getting on our way but I saw him in the lobby. Very friendly and cute. sure, people with allergies should be aware of that. I would definitely advice my friends to stay there. We got a fair deal for what we paid. If you're a budget traveler with no extreme needs for luxury it's the right place to stay. The only downside could be no Internet in the room. But they've got it in the lobby and kindly let use it. I'm sorry I can't add good photos representing hotel. All we made were personal ones. I'll add a few slightly edited ones (covering myself) Hope it's ok for this site. Just wanted people to see at least a bit of the lovely room we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Oh no, not the basement!”
Reviews.Author: WorcsReluctant_flyer
Reviews.Content: We also had the basement suite, not knowing it was the basement before we arrived. The noise from the creaky floor in the breakfast room started very early. The windows were at street level and without insulation, it was noisy when people walked by or bike chains jangled. The local church bell chimed on the hour all through the night.........! My husband lived on this street and knew the previous owners, Hans and Johan. He insisted on staying at the Washington. The bedrooms and bathroom were clean BUT tea and coffee making facilities were sorely missed! The staff were efficient but a little confrontational as has been mentioned on another review, also they were dressed for a building site not for waiting table!!! If we ever visit Amsterdam again, we may consider the Washington as it's handy for trams and amenities. I would recommend this hotel for a friend but with a warning!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: bluedblued
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hote Washington for 3 nights. We arrived late (11pm). The staff were very friendly. They gave us the information required about the hotel and said I could pay the following day to allow me to get cash to avoid the 4% credit card charge! We were on the fourth floor up some very steep stairs. There were four rooms that shared a shower room and separate toilet. I think the other floors may be ensuite. We didnt see or hear anyone else on the fourth floor during our stay. The room was clean, very basic but included a digital safe, tv, wardrobe, clock radio and wash basin. The hotel was a short tram ride to the centre or about a 20 minute walk. All we needed the hotel for was to sleep in - there's so much to do in Amsterdam the last place you want to be is in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: yellowvase
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here, they helped greatly in making the decision to stop at this hotel. As you will read in other reviews, it has recently changed ownership - the new owners were not friendly, but we didnt really have many dealings with them. We arrived in Amsterdam early - took the tram (16 or 24) from Central Station to Ruesdyalstraat (if you follow the road round to the right you will see Hotel Washington across the street on the left). We were not able to check into the hotel until 2pm, but we were allowed to leave our bags in the dining room. When we came later to check in, we were dealt with quickly. We had booked a 3 person apartment - we were told it was on the 3rd floor. We were aware that the stairs in the hotel were steep - but honestly, nothing prepares you for them (see picture!) Going up them the first time was a nightmare, my legs were aching after the first set! We were expecting a bit of help with our luggage but we recieved none. The apartment itself was very big - with a balcony! Had no complaints about the room, maybe a little old fashioned and dated, but for what we paid we were happy. We were bitten in bed though - we belived the blankets they put on over the sheet were the cause of this! Fortunately it wasnt cold so we didnt really need the blankets! Our room was cleaned and tidied every day between 12 and 3, but we were generally out before then. When checking out, we tackled the stairs with our luggage and gave the key back to the owners. This was only the second time during our stay that we had contact with them! A word of warning - dont be fooled into buying your food and drink from the shop by the tram stop - they are so expensive and charge you for items you havent even bought! Instead, turn right out of the hotel and keep walking until you see a store called Albert Heijn - great value and theres a few of these in the town centre aswell! I would stay here again definately.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: LondonMouse1
Reviews.Content: i have never wrote a hotel review so far, but this was the worst experience i ever had staying in a hotel: the rooms are totally overpriced, beds have old mattresses, towels in the bathroom were full of holes and dirt and i also found dust inside my bed. On top of this you are forced to leave the room by 11 am in the morning (just minutes more you are charged another night) and they call you 45 mins upfront to clarify in a very rude tone that you have to leave. Although the location is good, i would noone recommend to stay in this place.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: blackjack82
Reviews.Content: We traveled as a group of 4 and therefore stayed in the basement 'suite'. this means you have two bedrooms, a bathroom and a hallway to yourself with a private door. the rooms were all very light and spacious, and there is plenty of wadrobe space and a bookcase of left behind books. however the steps down were VERY steep, but this seems to be the case in most places in amsterdam. the hotel was clean, the breakfast was continental, but of a good quality. we had a tv in each room with a few english speaking channels. there was also a hairdryer and fan, although no coffee making facitities.the only issue with staying in the basement is you are below the dining room and therefore it is VERY noisy from around 7am but is otherwise very quiet for the rest of the day. the staff were friendly when you made the effort to speak to them, they were very helpful in giving us local information but kept themselves to themselves mainly. we never felt they were rude or unreasonable. we came home late on a few occasions but no one complained to us about being noisy so even though this is a quiet hotel, you can still use it as a base for a more lively holiday. as said previously the hotel is round the corner from the tram line there is also a small shop selling most things you would get in the uk. you are about 10mins away from the museums and the park and about 15 mins away from plenty of nice bars and resturants including hard rock cafe. the website clearly states you will need to pay upfront when you check in so have your money ready (remember the tax also) we paid 630 euro for 4 people for 5 nights which really was a bargain (esp with the prices in amsterdam - pint of beer is around 5 euro). also we were told no drugs in the hotel so you would be best to check before you book, but obviously amsterdam is very liberal with this so it shouldnt be a problem finding somewhere else. the bars smell very much of weed and tobacco, which took a bit of getting used to from the uk smoking ban. i felt this hotel was excellent value for money and was in a great location - if you fancy a walk it is only around 30 min walk to the main area (red light, train station) and this is a nicer area to stay in. i would reccomend the hotel but would think twice if i had children under 5 or those with mobility problems (although you may have problems with most stairs in amsterdam).

Reviews.Title: “OK, could be better”
Reviews.Author: michaVienn
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights. The hotel is nice, very close to tram stop and museum area. Price is good for an Amsterdam hotel. Breakfast is average. There is no elevator and the staicase is steep. The sheets were ok but the bed covers were rather smelly. The personel watches with wireless cameras the breakfast room and the staircase, leaving you with the impression that your room may be watched too. I will stay in an other hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: StarlightCat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my 15 year old daughter. I chose it based on the location as well as guide book and Trip Advisor reviews. Room was large, overlooking a court yard. Great shower! The street is a quiet side-street so I would imagine front rooms are fairly quiet, too. We thought breakfast was quite adequate. Staff was not overly friendly, but we didn't find them rude, either. My daughter actually enjoyed talking to one of the staff when she went to find out about internet access. (We had a laptop with us; wireless is available). The location is a bit out of the center of the city, near the Museum Plein and right on a tram line -- so getting to the center or back again when you are tired after a day of site seeing is easy. (Buy a 15 ride "strippenkart" for the bus/tram. 2 people can use the same one). Others mentioned the stairs -- I have to agree -- steep narrow stairs; probably not good for young children or older folks, but the staff carried our luggage up for us. Overall, great for the price, (100 euros a night).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: eacrites
Reviews.Content: I had to rate this hotel average due to the size of the room I had, a little small for the money. I also had to rate it average due to the fact that they were doing construction next door due to a leaky roof. (Which they did not inform me about, however apologized for later.) I would however, recommend this hotel for the location, right near the museums, Van Gogh, etc., and easy access to canal trips. The breakfast was good and the staff seemed friendly enough. Heed their warning that the stairs are steep in the hotel and remember to pack light there.

Reviews.Title: “Faded but excellent value”
Reviews.Author: etaoin
Reviews.Content: Some of the earlier reviews are a bit too harsh. I have stayed here three times in the past 12 years, the most recent being this month. Yes, the decor has not changed, and the current operators aren't as colorful and gracious as some of their predecessors have been. The breakfast and common areas are quite spartan. But -- the price is half what you would pay for just a slight improvement. We stayed in one of the apartments (170 Euro a night, 2 bedrooms, electric piano, living room and full kitchen) which comes without breakfast (bakeries, delicatessens and a big underground supermarket are within 2 blocks). Fully functional wireless internet for 5 Euro a day, although we weren't charged. Linens were new, towels a little worn but absolutely clean. Lots of room and storage. Yes, you need to pay for your room when you check in, or soon after. There is 5% tax. If you don't have cash, credit cards incur a 4% charge. ATMs seem to be the best deal for getting cash in the Netherlands. The staff is reasonable though and waited a couple of days for payment. Entirely recommended, if you don't need coddling and don't mind climbing steep stairs. The apartments are particularly good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: letsgoeverywhere
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Hotel Washington. I liked the location, it is located in a more residential area but right down the road from the major museums. The management was nice, letting me use their personal laptop to check my e-mail and making me a coffee on a rainy afternoon. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was not fancy but it was nice to get something beyond a donut. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate rooms, strange policies”
Reviews.Author: DCvagabond1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Washington is located in a very nice part of Amsterdam, close to the Rijsmuseum and ConcertGebouw on a very peaceful side street. The rooms are comfortable, although the decor leans to dark colors. Everything was reasonably clean, and the breakfast was adequate. One note: the stairs are incredibly steep and there are lots of them. However, the management of this hotel seems to view customers as people to be policed rather than welcomed. There are signs all over the hotel about the policies on visitors to the rooms, check-in, check-out, the times the the rooms can be cleaned, no loud music, etc. All of this is fine, but the attitude of the staff seems to be that they are there to keep the guests in line, rather than create a friendly environment. For instance, I misplaced my room key (the usual plastic card type) and asked for a replacement. I was reprimanded and told that I would be charged 10 Euros for the new key and another ten if I needed another one. I was also told that it was against hotel policy for me to visit my traveling companions in their room (no visitors in rooms!) for a drink before dinner (they were staying in a suite; we are 66, 62, and 47 so it is not like we were planning to throw a giant party and ask people in off the street.) The friendliest creature there was the cat. I would stay there again because it is a good facility, but don't expect anything but hassles from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Service was non existant...”
Reviews.Author: TheDCD
Reviews.Content: Rude staff, confusing payments, and we could not even have a bru at 10pm even though i offered to pay 3 euro and me and my friend were like 5 steps away and could see the kettle and i was tired from the day to be bothered going out, plus side is though cannabis can be smoked in the rooms which was a bonus and a lifeline also the breakfast was nice and the location was also good, overall 5/10 one peice of advice dont expect any such of a decent service especially for 65 euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise payment policies”
Reviews.Author: J&DHope
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we were told that the entire room tarif had to be paid in advance in cash, or if we used our credit card, an additional credit card fee would be applied to the tarif. Neither of these policies had been mentioned in any of our correspondence or reservations. We were tired from traveling that day, and did not feel like looking for another hotel, or arguing the issue, so we paid the extra fee. The hotel clerk on duty at that time was also the least helpful and friendly of the three clerks that we encountered there. We made the best of the situation, but our overall experience at this hotel was tainted by this misrepresentation. We are aware of the practice by some businesses of charging extra when credit cards are used, but would prefer to be informed of this policy in advance. Ditto for the policy of cash in full at time of check-in. Therefore, we cannot recommend this hotel nor would we stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and Helpfull”
Reviews.Author: MAREXSingapore
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there 1 week and I have enjoyed my stay... I highly recomend to everyone... MAREX GLOBAL

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: lindale
Reviews.Content: Hotel Washington is located in a quiet residential suburb, close to the Van Gough Museum & Rijksmuseum. Use a number 16 or 24 tram. It is a clean hotel with larger than average rooms, which are simply, but comfortably furnished. Our room had a very comfy bed, and a large balcony, on which we were able to take chairs out on to enjoy the evening sunshine. There was a small TV with excellent picture quality with many channels, including BBC1 & 2. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We were subject to having a large amount of money stolen by a pickpocket on the tram, and one of the staff drove us to the police station so we could report the incident, he waited while we made statements and helped out with any details we were unsure of, and finally took us to a restaurant so we were able to get a meal. He would accept nothing but our gratitude. Thanks guys! For a 2 star hotel, this represents very good value for money and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best 2 star hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: YoungAnneYoung
Reviews.Content: This is the best 2 star hotel that I have stayed in, better than some with more stars. After reading other reviews I booked with some trepidation!! but needing to find somewhere on a low budjet I decided to take the chance. The area is one of the nicer quiet areas of Amsterdam but with the tramstop into the Centre of Amsterdam at the end of the road it was perfect with only a very cheap fare to pay. The owners couldnt have been nicer or more friendly to us and helped us greatly with any queries we had. The hotel is spotlessly clean, including the bedding which is the most important thing to me. I can usually cope with anything else. The breakfast was plentiful and you could have eaten more than your fill. The room (which I expected to be the usual 2 star hotel ( no windows) had huge sunny windows looking out onto the street below, it had been newly decorated and had new curtains. The bed was very comfortable as I can not stand hard beds. I slept like a log. You can hear noise from other rooms but this is not a problem as being that little bit further out of the centre of Amsterdamam the hotel attracted more considerate guests so this was not a problem. There is a nice little garden at the back of the Hotel. I would just like to say a huge thankyou to the manager who couldnit have been kinder to us. but there is a little secret that I would like to let you in on. Give the hotel staff a smile!!!!!!!!!! treat them as you would like to be treated yourselves. They have a lot to contend with the general public. You will receive far better respect and treatment if you remember this.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendeus experience”
Reviews.Author: Leader1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using [--]nd further cancelled using [--], however after couple of days we saw that they charged our credit card- we had infact cancelled and had our cancellation confirmation emailed to us. We called hotel and also [--]but alas no help. Very bad customer service and no help at all. Please do not use any credit card to make reservations since your bank cannot help you get back your money and will ask you to deal with the merchant or vendor which is a nightmare- in the end we lost the money and did not even stay--horrible experience:(

Reviews.Title: “Used to be great!”
Reviews.Author: stevekm
Reviews.Content: Used to be such a great place but has slipped. I have been coming to Amsterdam (from USA) since 1997. I once heard about the Hotel Washington from Frommers. I took a chance and was pretty pleased for a long time. I got to know the owners there (Johann, John, Michael) just to name a few. I stayed there many times maybe taking two trips a year. I would stay there every time for a week usually, or at least for several nights. I just stayed there again after a two year absence and before I came back, when I made the reservations, I found out that the Washington had new owners. I called to make a reservation, but the receptionist told me that I had to so only from the internet. I even offered to send a fax, but he refused. Wonder what you do if you don't have internet access (like when your traveling)? When I got there I was sad to see all of the help that they use to work there, now gone. They kept up with the same deal and feel for what it was, but the people that worked there before, were really 30% of the stay. The way they would look out for you!! Making sure everything was ok with the room etc... The Breakfast are exactly the same that they were before. No problems there. But two things that I can say I was dissappointed with: One, how much money would it be for them to just get all new bedding?!! It;s too old. And now about the new owners, (Turkish) One is rather gruff, telling me 2 or 3 times in the same first meeting that it was under new management and basically "things are different now". No improvements, just banking on the past success and return businesn. The staff are either cold non helpful (he seemed like he had a bit of attitude.) and the other one's English was pretty bad! (My Dutch friend tried to make arrangements with him to call me a Taxi early in the morning and was not convinced that he new enough Dutch to know exactly when we said we needed the Taxi. I actually got up an extra hour earlier, just so I could pull my luggage out the main street and catch a cab in the case he didn't show up. Then lastly, when the cab did show up....it was one of the hotel manager's Turkish friends (still an Amsterdam cab) but the whole week I felt a little too handled. I think who ever owns the Hotel Washington now should invest a few Euros in new bedding, and get the guys downstairs to learn how to say, "Good Morning" with a smile and just be more pleasnt. I won't go back to HW, but there is a newer (clean) hotel just a few houses down the same street called the Hotel van Kasteelen. I think it's a little more money, but I've head good things about it. Maybe if the new management at the HW get some guidance on how hotels are supposed to be run, I might return there, but I can tell that won't be happening for a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: alicen007
Reviews.Content: I knew this hotel when I lived in Amsterdam, when friends and family would stay there when they came to visit, it was such a gem to have close by. Unfortunately, when I stayed there last weekend, all had changed, I learnt that the hotel management had changed since 2006, the staff was quite blunt and spoke limited English, our bedroom stank of cigar smoke, the bed mattress was horrible, the beddings had holes although they were clean, the furniture was not quite the same as it used to be, and the whole place stank of cigarette. Considering the price paid for a room per night (it had to be cash and I never got a receipt), it was not worth it at all! Too bad for such a beautiful place which is so well located!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: hersheyfrogs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last month with his parents in an apartment. The apartment was a good value with lots of space and a kitchen to cook your own food; however, I agree with previous reviewers that the linens were shabby. The location is further from the city center, but very close to the museums (and a grocery store). The area was quiet when we were there as well. The stairs are extremely steep up to the apartment. We got there before check-in, but were allowed to leave our luggage. It had been carried up to the apartment when we came back to check in. The staff member we talked with was friendly. He gave us a map and pointed out several things to do. I would stay here again if I needed space for more than 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: kimette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights at the end of March/07. Generally, the stay was all right. The management was friendly (even if I had read other reviews prior to leaving that management was unfriendly/unhelpful etc). They helped us with directions, suggesting sights as well as restaurants. Somewhat on the blunt side, but I have to say they were generally friendly and helpful. The breakfast was OK. We were seated and then a plate of cheese/meat (just enough for the both of us) was brought to our table with a basket of various breads. We were asked if we wanted a boiled egg or not. Coffee/orange juice as well as a variety of cereals were provided buffet style. Although sufficient, we were somewhat bored by the same kind of meat/cheese offered every morning for 3 days. Would have been nice to have a bit of a variety. The room was quite comfortable. Large windows with clean bathroom. Our only complaint was the bedding - very ragged, falling apart at the seams. Considering what we were paying, it would be nice if they invested in some new bedding. All in all, a quiet , residential neighbourhood. It is also very easy to get around town. The tram is a very short walking distance away. Kimette

Reviews.Title: “clean and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: harvey1066
Reviews.Content: a good clean hotel. could be nosy outside due to trams being 75 yards from the hotel.stairs are very steep so care is needed!continental breakfast is served plated with limited choice. but good value hotel

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ganno
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel on the basis of the good reviews on trip advisor. We were disappoionted however. Our room and bathroom were very big and good value but the staff were VERY unfriendly. Breakfast was just OK but if you asked for extra bread, for example, it was served begrudgingly. Because of the surly staff the atmosphere in the hotel is bad and we would definitely not stay there again and would recommend you look elsewhere for accommodation

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Travalin
