Reviews.Content: I had planned to write a review about this hotel when I returned last year but never got around to it till now. The hotel is a bit outside the main part of town in a quite leafy road. This was not a problem. The trams were very frequent and cheap we never waited more than 5 min for one. We walked from the centre of town out to the hotel in less than 30 min. we like walking/ sightseeing There is a nice local bar/restaurant just on the corner that I recommend trying. If you are after museums this is a perfect position. Price wise it was a bargain. The rooms were very clean the staff was friendly and the breakfast good. The stairs is very steep and there is no lift (not for the unfit) but this is normal for the older buildings in Amsterdam. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, not so good Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Darren101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October because of the reviews we have seen on tripadvisor. The location of this hotel could not be better. It is in a really nice residential area, 5 minutes walk to the Van Gogh Museum. The owners were not the friendliest people we have met; I would go so far as to say rude. They have a lot to learn about the hospitality business. The room we stayed in was at the top of the guesthouse and was very small, cramped and noisy. Overall I would not recommend this guesthouse.

Reviews.Title: “Sooo much better than we expected!!”
Reviews.Author: AMGiglio
Reviews.Content: We had read horrible reviews about this hotel---until a couple of months ago when it was indicated that they had refurbished and gone under new management--and the reviews got so much better. We took a leap of faith--upon a recommendation from someone who had recently stayed at this hotel. We arrived--and were pleasantly surprised!! The management and staff were very professional and so helpful. The room was HUGE and clean. It was not fancy--but very functional. The furniture was modest--but the beds were sooo comfortable and cozy. The breakfast in the am was very good. Hotel Washington is also very close to a tram stop--and within walking distance of the Van Gogh Museum and Rikesmuseum. If you want a functional, clean and friendly atmosphere--this is a great value and I strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “New owners! Be careful”
Reviews.Author: Herman_Blinkhoven
Reviews.Content: People be aware that the high ratings and excellent standing of this hotel are based on the work of the previous owners. The hotel is, sadly, under new management since a year now. Things have degraged. The new owners are dedicated but most of the staff are unexperienced, rather curt, speak little english, have very short fuses and a few members of the staff, might perhaps consider to care about basics of personal hygiene. This saddens me, because the Washingtn, old style was a gem. The location is still great, but this does not justify prices at the current level.

Reviews.Title: “the washington is ok”
Reviews.Author: manolomo
Reviews.Content: WeÂ´re a spanish group of 7 people betwen 28-30 years old. Two couples was in the quad room, quad room are two differents room with one share bathroom, the quad room is in the basement so is so noisy otherwise the rooms are spacious and very clean. A problem about quad room is the window wich are under the floor so the ventilation of the room is very poor (and the owners donÂ´t allow open the windows if youÂ´re not inside because cats go inside the room). About the triple room is ok, it has a balcony, a great bathroom, .... On the other hand the first night the hotel was complete so we were in the fourth floor: THE STAIRS ARE LIKE A NIGHTMARE, don,t book in the third or fourth floor you will be too tired and you can,t visit the city. Summing up, very clean, central and tired

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMember
Reviews.Content: Date; August, 2006 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Victoria, Canada We recently stayed for 5 days at the Hotel Washington in Amsterdam. There were 3 of us, including our son. We had booked the room (the apartment suite on the second floor) in January, after reviewing the great reviews in TripAdvisor.com. We knew the hotel had changed ownership at the start of the year, and so we were somewhat unsure how that might affect our stay. I am happy to report that the hotel lived up to all of our expectations. Yes, the climb up the stairs is very steep, and perhaps the new owners are not as friendly as the old owners, but it is still an excellent hotel for the money. The main advantage the Hotel Washington has is its location, close to the museums, Vondel Park and the Albert Cuyp Street market. You can easily walk to all of these places; in fact we walked right down to Dam Square. If you are not into walking then there is a tram stop right around the corner. The other big advantage for the Hotel Washington is that it is on a very quiet street. There was virtually no street noise that we had to deal with at night, although there was some noise in the building one night from the hallway, and the room upstairs. However the management were aware of the problem the next morning, and it did not happen again. The apartment we had was great for the 3 of us as it gave our son his own private room. We also had a kitchen and a balcony to sit on outside if we wanted to. You could quibble about the breakfast, and some of the carpeting was old, but on balance we enjoyed our stay, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Yoshibird
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at washington hotel. Beds were comfortable. Located in a nice quiet area. Quick/Convenient tram ride to city center. Breakfast was adequate - salami, cheese, boiled egg, toast/jelly/peanut butter, oj, milk, cold cereal, coffee. sometimes fresh apple/banana. Worth the price, would recommend this place if you are comfortable with public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, nice ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Satine
Reviews.Content: Based on the good reviews we read before visiting Amsterdam, we decided to book Hotel Washington through easytobook.com. I'm happy to say the reviews - and our decision - were right. Many of the other hotels we saw were in busy areas and we wondered about the noise. Hotel Washington, by comparison, is located on a quiet street about three blocks from the Museumplein tram stop. Our second-floor room (good size, with two twin beds pushed together) had a veranda which overlooked a pretty courtyard. We had a private bathroom with a shower. The room was kept clean. The stairs (like all over Holland) are pretty steep, but you get used to them. We first arrived about 7 a.m. and were able to leave our luggage at the hotel while we went out exploring (check in begins @ 2 p.m.). **Note: They require a 10 Euro deposit for the key card (refunded when you check out), so it's a good idea to exchange some money before you arrive.** The owners recently adopted an adorable kitten, who adds a cute touch to the surroundings. I do agree the breakfast choices were limited, but hey, it's one less meal you have to worry about paying for. It did the job and we were satisfied. The guys who run the place are helpful but not overly friendly. Their English is good, though, so communicating wasn't a problem. As is typical, the hotel didn't have air conditioning and our stay was during Europe's heat wave. Fortunately, the French doors to the veranda provided a nice breeze. I would highly recommend Hotel Washington.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic place”
Reviews.Author: DougP
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at Hotel Washington in November 2005 (just now getting off my (--) to write this review). Evidently the management has changed which is too bad because the people we dealt with back in November were really friendlly and helpful, and spoke totally fluent English (Johann and Hans I think). The hotel is on a quiet resdential street lined with 5-6 story townhouses. Van Gogh and Rijksmusuem are a 5 minute walk. Surrounding neighborhood is not super interesting but pleasant. There's a nice grocery store near the museums as well as a couple of tram stops. Hotel was quiet and clean. My brother's room facing the rear courtyard was nice enough though my room facing the street was a bit ugly and a little depressing though clean and functional. Breakfast was basic but acceptable and the breakfast room was really nice with classical music playing in the background. Good experience overall. I wouldn't go out of my way to stay there again but I'd consider it.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. but close to the museums”
Reviews.Author: ThoughtsbyMaria
Reviews.Content: I had made reservations for this hotel in November 2005. At that time I got very prompt email responses. A couple weeks before my family was to leave Seattle to go to Amsterdam I emailed just to reconfirm my reservation. I did this a couple of times and never got a response which I thought was strange and annoying. Thankfully we were able to check in without any troubles. I realized that the hotel was under new ownership. We arrived at about 8:00 in the morning and they said our room wouldn't be ready until 2:00 pm. I expected this to be the case and based on my email conversations in November asked where we could put our luggage. We were told to leave it in a small lobby area. This was disappointing as there was no secure area to leave our luggage. I had assumed there would be a locked storage room. But it turned out that we had no troubles. The rooms were clean and it was a quiet part of town. The staff was cordial but not over the top friendly as I had read in previous reviews. I think this is because of new ownership. There were some language barriers with some of the staff but we made do. They did always respond to our requests. To sum it up I would say the hotel and it's staff were nice but not fantastic. I think my husband and I would try out another hotel in the future just for variety sake. But we wouldn't be devastated if we had to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: Vranka
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel was in a very reasonable proximity to all major attractions. The room was large a clean. We even had a terrace. I did not think the staff was perhaps as accomodating as we had hoped and the breakfast was modest to say the least if you like a sandwhich for breakfast (one slice of salami and one slice of cheese). No breakfast at all would have been better. Overall, we thought the hotel was very decent value for the price, yet we did not truly feel welcome. I would still recommend the hotel to the budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “We liked Hotel Washington”
Reviews.Author: DaisyDancer
Reviews.Content: There were 6 of us who stayed at this hotel for several days in April. As it was our first trip to Amsterdam, we have no way to compare this hotel to any other there. We found the Hotel Washington to be very clean, very quiet, and loaded with atmosphere. The owners have had it just since January, so are still getting things worked out, but they, and their staff, proved to be quite friendly and very helpful. They gave us suggestions for places to eat, sold us stamps, answered our questions patiently, etc. Our room was up one flight of stairs, but others were higher. (As I had recently had a total knee replacement, I was glad to have just the one flight to climb!) There is no lift, so any guests must be able to climb steep stairs, or fly. The room was large and comfy, the bed was comfy, the bathroom was huge and had both tub and shower. We were given clean towels every day and the bed was made every day. The breakfast was tasty and all we needed. They offer boiled eggs, bread/toast, fresh fruit, orange juice, corn flakes, granola, slices of ham and cheese, coffee, tea, milk, and hot chocolate. The boiled egg is served to you in a neat little egg cup. The 'dining room' can seat maybe 18 people, so you can easily visit with other guests. At night, if I wanted a cup of cocoa, I just took my own cup down to the kitchen and asked for hot water, then returned to our room and made my own. No problem. The hotel is located within walking distance of many small shops, and a huge outdoor market, and is a block or so from a tram stop. We would definitely stay at the Hotel Washington again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied with Hotel Washington”
Reviews.Author: lquinnie
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in a double room at the Hotel Washington for 4 nights (booked through easytobook.com) in May 2006 and found it to be a perfectly adequate, small hotel for the budget-conscious traveler. It is situated on a picturesque, quiet street and is conveniently located within short walking distance to 2 of the major museums in Amsterdam: the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum. Although it was farther away from the hub of activity around the Central Train Station and Dam Square, it was less than a 10-minute tram ride to this area. (To get to the hotel from Central Station or Dam Square, take either tram 16 or 24 and get off at the Ruysdaelstraat stop; the hotel is about a minute's walk farther--follow the tram tracks around the corner onto Johannes Vermeerstraat--you can see Hotel Washington from the corner of Johannes Vermeerstraat and Frans van Mierisstraat). The hotel staff were friendly and accommodating. The room itself (#8), including the bathroom, was very clean and was spacious by European standards. The bed and pillows were quite comfortable. The breakfast was also adequate: coffee, tea, OJ, milk, choice of 3 cold cereals, fresh fruit (apples, oranges), toast with butter/jelly/peanut butter, and soft-boiled egg served in an egg cup with sliced cheese and salami. The only negative feedback I have regarding the hotel room is the odor of cigarette smoke. However, I realize that in a hotel as small as this that it would be difficult to designate rooms as non-smoking, although this would be the ideal. As is the case in most of the older homes in Amsterdam, the steps in the hotel are steep and narrow. A member of the hotel staff explained that due to restrictions by the Amsterdam historical society, it is not possible to alter the interior of the building so that a lift can be added. If you are able-bodied, you should have no trouble navigating the stairs, although it could be somewhat difficult with large or heavy luggage; the staff did offer to help us with our bags, but we declined and had no problem getting our bags (and ourselves!) up to the 3rd floor. Overall, I was very satisfied with the hotel. PS: If you like Indian food, there is an excellent Indian restaurant within a couple minutes' walk of the hotel, just past the Ruysdaelstraat tram stop on a street corner on the left-hand side of the street (I specify that it is on the corner because there is another Indian restaurant a few storefronts down on the same side of the street). My fiance and I agreed that this was the best Indian restaurant we've ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, liked location”
Reviews.Author: nidahodave
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Washington during first week of April 2006. Positives: very quiet location, easy access to tram system, close to museums and concert hall, close to Albert Cuypmarkt market, decent size room. Negatives: typical dutch townhouse with 5 floors so will require using stairs as high as fifth floor rooms(no elevator), breakfast is on small side and isn't served until 8:30 am, and hotel is some distance from core of Amsterdam so using public transportation is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Washington!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from three days at Hotel Washington. I stayed in a suite there and it was brilliant. There was a kitchen, a really nice bathroom and a lovely double bed. The place was kept really clean and the staff were helpful and answered all the questions we had. Breakfast was included in the price and it was nice although nothing exciting. The only downside was that the hotel was about a 20 minute tram journey from the center of Amsterdam, but the tram stop was only a minutes walk away and the trams were reliable and cheap, so this was not really too much of a disadvantage. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “OK stay at the Washington”
Reviews.Author: UMgirl
Reviews.Content: The positives- The room was beautiful and very large. It had a balcony, beautiful windows and a chandelier, nice sitting area and a desk. The beds were 2 twins pushed together and were comfy enough. Good heat as well which was needed b/c it was quite cold out. The hotel is in a quiet area. The negatives- The location wasn't great for us. It is good if you want to spend your time there near the museums but we found it annoying to travel all the way to the center or from the center back to the hotel. For this reason alone we would not stay here again. It would have been nice to have tea/coffee facilities in the room....we tried to bring up juice/coffee one morning at breakfast and were told we were not allowed, so b/c of this we did not eat breakfast although it looked standard anyway (cereal/cheese/meats). The last thing I want to mention is that I would have hoped the staff would have been more friendly....

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: agerwer13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Washington during a 3 day stay in Amsterdam. The room was rather large by European standards, but it was up a trek of three flights of very steep stairs. They were fine, but just a warning for those who may not want to walk up the stairs. The location is outstanding and there are two tram stops very close to the hotel. The bathroom was nice too. The breakfast was ok. I would have wanted a yogart or something in the morning. All they gave you was a boiled egg (which I don't eat), bread, and two slices of cheese and meat. The staff did answer all questions that were asked of them, and gave good directions when asked for traditional Dutch food. They even printed out walking directions for us. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel In Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: zombyw00f
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a three day stay at the Hotel Washington and absolutely loved it. I have been to Amsterdam many times before, and have stayed in hotels ranging from five to two stars, so I speak from experience when I say this is certainly the best hotel of the lot. Firstly, the location just can't be beat. It's situated on a quiet street about two blocks from the Museumsplein in a non-touristy area. It was a short walk to the Leidsplein and right across the street from the tram. There's a lovely italian bistro right down the block with excellent food and an even better vibe. Now, the rooms... As you probably know, Amsterdam is not known for their enormous hotel rooms (unless you pay the big bucks, of course) so we were very pleasantly surprised at how big and comfortable our room was. King size bed, two big dressers, a chandelier, a large outside deck with a view of a courtyard, and a bathroom with a real shower (yes, it actually had a curtain!) All this for 65 euros a night! The only downside was that there is no elevator (it's a historic building) and dutch steps are like going up a ladder. But our host, Dennis (the new owner) helped us carry our heavy luggage up 3 flights of steps. The breakfast was good, nothing incredible, but it was included with the already low price, so I can't complain. The last reviewer did not stay in the actual hotel, so take it with a grain of salt. In my opinion, there is no better place to stay in Amsterdam, unless you want to plunk down 500 euros a night at the Amstel. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: perigee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam and stayed at the Hotel Washington based on the fabulous Tripadvisor reviews. We rented a 2 BR apt. for Euro 200/night for 3 women. Our apartment, #23, was just OK. I guess threadbare would definitely be a good way to describe it, although it did seem clean. There was a odd number of doors leading to the apartment, one of which was a vinyl accordian-style door with a weak looking lock, which made us nervous about leaving our valuables, especially since the hotel has no safes available to its guests. There was a small kitchen and very small bathroom, which were functional. I have seen apartment rentals in Amsterdam on the web which looked much nicer, in the pictures anyway. The new owners seemed indifferent at best. I have been to Amsterdam many times on business, so our group didn't require any assistance with getting around, etc., but the couple of questions we had were met with unclear answers. One of our questions was about the Connexxion Shuttle service from the airport, a good deal and very convenient. The Hotel Washington is linked on their website, but evidently they have now lost their contract with the shuttle. I did not see the rooms in the actual hotel, since we stayed in an adjoining apartment, but our rooms were cleaned once in our 3-night stay. I would look into staying at a different hotel on a future trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “This could be the last time Maybe the last time I don't know”
Reviews.Author: RobertMellors
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to this Hotel but sadly it is changing ownership in Jan 06 so things will probably change. For the record all the staff are outstanding. Nothing it would seem is too much trouble if they can do it they will. Even the cleaning staff are great. Henry was cleaning our room singing away. Why are you so happy i said. I'm a christian, Praise the Lord, was his reply. Great location. Restaurants abound and all are first class by UK standards.

Reviews.Title: “This is where you want to be”
Reviews.Author: youngtraveldude
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Amsterdamn, and I couldn't have picked a better place to stay. Upon arriving at the Amsterdam airport, you will want to look for the blue Schiphol Hotel shuttles ----- These shuttles are the only economical way to get from the airport to your hotel. Check out the website for a picture of the shuttle, so you know what to look for when you walk out of the airport. When I arrived at Hotel Washington, I was warmly greeted by Rolf, who couldn't have been more genial and warm. He gave me the "basics" on gettting around the city and where things were located...even took the time to draw up a map for me on how to get to the local gym. ROOMS: I know some have mentioned the steep staircase leading to the rooms, but I am young and in good shape, so this really wasn't an issue for me. Even if your fat and out of shape, I still don't see it as a big issue. Anyway, my room was perfect. Comfortable bed, cable television. My room, which was specifically a single room, was smaller, but nice sized for one person. I know Rolf has much larger room available as well. My bathroom was clean, with all the hot water i needed. Located on a quiet street, so I slept soundly with no outside noise. FOOD: I am an American, and in my country, we value and cherish a big morning breakfast. Well, I couldn't have come to a better place for a great breakfast (which is included in your room rate). When I sleepily walked downstairs in the morning, I was shown to a table, where a full Thermas of coffee awaited me. I told them I liked scrambled eggs, and the proceeded to make me one of the best scrambled egg meals I have ever eaten. Complete with all kinds of toast, cheese and fruit. This was truly a breakfast cooked to order, right out of their kitchen. EXTRAS: This is more like a bed and breakfast, but I must add...in NO WAY was my privacy ever encroached upon. Staff was warm and unbelievably friendly, but never were overbearing or nosy. Also, this location is GREAT!! You are just a 10 minute walk from the heart of Amsterdam. The Red Light District, various gyms and coffee shops are only a walk away. And the street Hotel Washington is located on is one of most beautiful in Amsterdam. I will be back in 2 months for a longer stay, and wouldn't stay anywhere else than HOTEL WASHINGTON! If you have any questions, feel free to email me. I travel the world and love to help fellow travellers. Amsterdam is a beautiful city and Hotel Washington is a beautiful place to call home during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem In Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The room was very spacious, and the Hotel service is so warm and helpfull, almost like you are being lodged in a friends house. The location is perfect. near to two magor tram lines. Walking distance to Museums,but still very quiet (which is very important for some of us). Since we stayed in the Queens day, most areas can be noisy through the night. The neighberhood is nice, yet offers resturants and place to stroll at night. One thing you must bear in mind: The stairs are very steep, even for the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “One more positive review!”
Reviews.Author: daveAZBC
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights recently at the Hotel Washington in Amsterdam, near MuseumPlein. We found it here on TripAdvisor and were sold by the many positive reviews. We found it to be exactly as described. Our room (at 120 Euros per night) was large, clean, quiet, and well-furnished. The breakfasts were excellent and the friendly staff were very helpful with any questions or recommendations. The three flights of stairs were tiring, but a useful contributor to our fitness program! A good thing that the staff willingly hauls all your luggage up and down the stairs. My wife and I would definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii03
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Hotel Washington based on reviews from others on TripAdvisor - we were not disappointed! This is a great little hotel - the service was excellent and friendly and it is situated in a great area for seeing the city. Especially nice was the fact that our flight arrived at 8am on the day we were checking in and when we arrived at the hotel at about 9am they let us check in right away and gave us breakfast - and didn't charge us anything extra! We were able to sleep off the jetlag for a few hours before seeing the sites and it made all the difference. The room was clean and quiet. The shower had fabulous hot water. Breakfast was simple, but good. And, as another reviewer mentioned, the staff response to email correspondence could not have been more timely. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Very charming”
Reviews.Author: kellyo69
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel with helpful staff and nice breakfast/breakfast room. Clean, close to transporation and Rijksmuseum - which is not to be missed. Quiet, safe neighborhood. As noted, there are very steep stairs, but the hotel has so much character! Loved the city. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “I Agree”
Reviews.Author: wheninroam
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Hotel Washington in August, based on reviews here. My experience matched that of others: a spacious room, excellent quiet location with an easy walk to the art museums and concert hall, a nice breakfast included, great response to my e-mail inquiries (the other top two hotels did not respond at all), and Hans, Johann & Johann were wonderful hosts. Any restaurant they recommend on Van Baerle Straat will be excellent. Many thanks to the Trip Advisor reviewers for locating this hotel!! p.s. if you have luggage, avoid the train from Schiphol airport. I could not get my large duffel bag up the narrow steps into the car; the loading area was filthy with shrapnel from a dropped ice cream bar; they do not announce stops; and despite my asking directions of several people including the on-board conductor who punched my ticket, I found myself on the wrong train. It was worth paying more for a taxi-cab.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal in all ways”
Reviews.Author: tiredfromtravelling
Reviews.Content: we stayed on the very top floor (share bathroom), which was a long way up, but unexpectedly had a large balcony and beautiful views. The character of the building and friendly staff made our stay here excellent. We loved the location and the breakfast too. Couldn't have been better!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: mlred99
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a room at the Hotel Washington based on Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. We had a bit of trouble finding the hotel at first, but mostly due to our own lack of direction. To save money we booked a top floor room with shared facilities, which, though it was not terrible, I would not recommend. As we were there in June, the weather was very warm and the temperature kept rising as you went up the stairs. Also the climb up those 4 flights of steep stairs was not a lot of fun! Our room was large and very clean and though we did not have our own ensuite, we did have a sink and mirror in the room. The room also had a large private balcony, which was great, but it meant that keeping the room cool was a bit more of a challenge (since there were no other windows). We kept the doors open at night, but there was a great deal of noise outside that kept us awake, especially in the early morning. I think it was from the construction at the Rijksmuseum nearby - including jackhammering and shouting. The breakfast downstairs was pretty good - an egg, lots of toast, fruit and cereal, as well as coffee and tea - and the staff was always extremely helpful and friendly. They recommended an indonesian restaurant nearby which was excellent and gave us some great advice about trams, attractions, etc. All in all our experience was very positive, and I believe that in a different room would have been even better. Next time in Amsterdam we will probably try to get a hotel room in a bit more of a central location (Leidseplein seemed to be where we always ended up), but I would recommend a stay in Hotel Washington to anyone looking for a budget-friendly hotel with excellent service in the museumplein.

Reviews.Title: “Top call!!”
Reviews.Author: RamblinHeart
Reviews.Content: We booked our accomodation based solely on the Travel Advisor rating, and it did not disappoint! The staff are nothing short of fantastic, the best I have encountered. The inclusive breakfast was great, as was location and facilities. My only word of warning is the very steep staircase. Anyone staying about the first floor would need to be aware that it's quite a vertical climb and can be difficult with large luggage etc. The rooms were clean, large and comfortable, although the colour scheme was not quite what I was used to. Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fluffy7
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all those reviewers who put me on to Hotel Washington. Just the sort of Hotel I love - very homey, comfortable, quiet. And the staff! From the moment I booked they couldn't have been more helpful. From helping with our luggage, to organising taxis and recommending restaurants - they were terriffic. For me, this was a wonderful location because of its proximity to the museums and Concertgebouw - but most of all for its peace and quiet. If this is what appeals to you as well - don't hesitate. You won't be disappointed. (But beware the steep stairs!).

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Washington
HotelInfo.Address: F. van Mierisstraat 10, Amsterdam 1071 RS, The Netherlands
